item.title: TryHackMe Linux PrivEsc Write-Up
item.description: This TryHackMe room gives us a vulnerable Debian virtual machine and demonstrates many different types of Linux privilege escalation techniques. There aren’t many challenges included in the room, but just knowing how many different ways attackers can root Linux boxes is valuable. In addition, several tools are provided that show us how easy it is to automate checking for privesc vulnerabilities on Linux. Contents Service Exploits Weak File Permissions Sudo Cron Jobs SUID/SGID Executables Passwords & Keys NFS Kernel Exploits Privilege Escalation Scripts Service Exploits Task 2 Follow the instructions given and you will end up with a setuid copy of bash to use to escalate your privileges.
